concise_definition: adj. 拥挤的, 装满的, 紧密的; v. (pack 的过去式和过去分词) 装箱, 填满, 拥挤

definitions.explanation_en: Filled tightly or to capacity with people, objects, or things, often to the point of being crowded or overloaded.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指被人、物或事物紧密填满，甚至达到拥挤或超载的程度。
definitions.example_en: The stadium was packed with fans cheering for their team.
definitions.example_cn: 体育场里挤满了为球队加油的球迷。

definitions.explanation_en: Containing a large amount of information, activity, or events in a short space of time or within a limited area.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在短时间内或有限空间内包含大量信息、活动或事件，内容密集。
definitions.example_en: It was a packed schedule with back-to-back meetings all day.
definitions.example_cn: 他的日程排得满满当当，一整天都是接连不断的会议。

definitions.explanation_en: To put things tightly or efficiently into a container, space, or group, often to maximize capacity.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指将物品紧密或高效地放入容器、空间或群体中，通常是为了最大化利用容量。
definitions.example_en: She packed her suitcase with clothes for the week-long trip.
definitions.example_cn: 她把一周旅行所需的衣物整齐地塞进了行李箱。

definitions.explanation_en: To gather or assemble a large number of people or things in a confined area, often implying density or intensity.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在有限区域内聚集大量的人或物，常暗示密度高或强度大。
definitions.example_en: The concert venue was packed before the show even started.
definitions.example_cn: 演出还没开始，演唱会场地就已经挤满了人。

comparison.analysis: “Crowded” (拥挤的) 侧重于人或动物过多导致空间紧张、行动不便，通常带有负面含义，强调主观不适感。而 “packed” 更强调物理上的完全填满，可能中性或积极（如“packed house”表示演出火爆），不一定有不适感。
“Filled” (装满的) 是一个通用词，仅表示某物被内容占据，但不强调紧密程度。例如“a filled bottle”只是有液体，而 “a packed suitcase” 意味着塞得严丝合缝、毫无空隙。因此 “packed” 比 “filled” 更具密集性和压迫感。
“Stuffed” (塞满的) 常用于非正式语境，带有轻微夸张或随意的意味，常用于食物（如 stuffed turkey）或柔软物体（如 stuffed animal）。而 “packed” 更正式、更广泛，适用于人、物、时间、信息等多种语境，且不带情感色彩。
